Program Name: Building Information Modeling Management
Code: T412
Credential: Ontario College Graduate Certificate
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 1 year (3 semesters)
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $9,468.00
International Tuition: $26,935.00
Program Availability:
- Fall 2024: Open (Domestic and International students)
- Winter 2025: Open (Domestic and International students)
- Spring 2025: Not Available (Domestic and International students)
Centre: Construction & Engineering Technologies
School: Angelo DelZotto School of Construction Management
Location: Casa Loma Campus
Program Description: Ontario’s first graduate certificate in Building Information Modelling. 95% of graduates gain full-time employment in the construction sector. Eligible for a $20,000 scholarship (for domestic students only). The program provides hands-on training to apply BIM principles to all project phases and use BIM technologies and management processes.

Context:
The text is about a one-year graduate certificate program offered by the college for using BIM tools and implementing BIM Management processes in organizations involved in building procurement, design, construction, and operation. Students will have access to advanced BIM lab facilities and learn practical skills through work environment and online modules.

Companies that accept BIM students for field experience include architectural, engineering, general contracting firms, subcontracting companies, government building departments, project developers, construction management firms, suppliers, and building manufacturing firms. Students must complete 450 hours of field experience, but the college does not guarantee a position. It is expected that students will be compensated for their field experience, though some may be unpaid or commission-based. Previous work experience in BIM can potentially be considered toward the mandatory field experience, and graduates are required to apply to graduate schools themselves upon completion of the program. There is an opportunity for students to engage in BIM-related applied research while completing the program.

The three-semester graduate certificate program includes a field experience in semester 3 to help students transition into the job market. Career options upon graduation include various project environments and positions that may involve practicing BIM. The text does not provide any specific information regarding program coordinators, emails, or names.

Context:
Program Offered: Building Information Modeling (BIM)
Positions after Graduation: BIM modeler, BIM specialist, BIM technologist, BIM coordinator, BIM construction officer, BIM manager, energy modeler, 3D laser scanner
Required Courses:
- Semester 1: BIM 1002 (BIM – Management), BIM 1006 (BIM – Pre-Construction Visualization), BIM 1007 (BIM – Revit-Architecture), BIM 1008 (BIM – Revit-Structures & MEP), BIM 1009 (BIM – Civil 3D)
- Semester 2: BIM 1010 (BIM – Implementation Strategies), BIM 1011 (BIM – Project Planning), Building Energy Modeling, BIM 1013 (BIM – Capstone Project), BIM 1015 (BIM Techniques – 3D Scanning), BIM 1024 (Field Experience Preparation)
- Semester 3: BIM 1018 (Construction Business Management, online), BIM 1019 (Leadership and Ethics for Construction Managers, Online), BIM 1020 (Field Experience, 450h)
Learning Outcomes: Assess requirements for construction industry Building Information Modeling (BIM) planning and management for Integrated Project Delivery (IPD), formulate strategies for leadership, team-building and personnel management, analyze BIM processes in integrated project delivery for the project lifecycle, conduct project risk analysis using BIM processes, execute appropriate BIM management techniques to facilitate integrated project delivery, apply team-building skills in an interdisciplinary setting and implement collaborative design and construction solutions, utilize BIM tools and platforms to create virtual models.
Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Tuition: $9,468.00 *
- International Tuition: $26,935.00 **
* Amounts listed are the estimated total of tuition, materials, student service and ancillary fees for the three semesters of the program starting in Fall 2023. Fees are subject to change.

Context:
Program Starting Dates and Fees:
- The program starts in Fall 2023 for the first three semesters.
- Estimated total tuition for domestic students for the first three semesters is $9,468. It can be paid in installments of $3,438 (fall), $3,022 (winter), and $3,008 (spring).
  Fees for programs starting from Fall 2024/Winter 2025 and later are subject to change.
- Financial assistance is approved for OSAP funding for eligible applicants.
- Admission requirements include a Bachelor's degree or Advanced Diploma in Construction, Civil, Mechanical, Electrical and Landscape Engineering, Architectural Studies and Interior Design. Domestic applicants with international transcripts need a Canadian equivalency evaluation from ICAS or WES.
  English language proficiency is required for international students whose transcripts are not in English.
- Course exemptions information can be found on the Transfer Guide page.
  International students should check the International Admissions page for country-specific admission requirements.

Context:
The Angelo DelZotto School of Construction Management at George Brown College has specific requirements for students regarding laptop and Internet specifications. Recommended home Internet speed is 25 to 40 Mbps with a ping time of 20–100 ms. The laptop specifications should have an operating system of Windows 10 Home 64-bit English, a 9th Generation Intel Core i7-9750H processor, 16GB (2x8GB DDR4 2666MHz) memory, 256GB M.2 PCIe NVMe Solid State Drive (Boot) + 1TB 5400 rpm 2.5" SATA Hard Drive (Storage), NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2060 6GB GDDR6 display card, and connectivity of 802.11ac WiFi and Bluetooth. Purchase of a Mac laptop is not recommended.

Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges, while international students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System. For more information, contact the Angelo DelZotto School of Construction Management at construction_mgmt@georgebrown.ca or call 416-415-5000, ext. 6297 during office hours from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m., room E228. Additional information about George Brown College can be obtained by calling the Contact Centre at 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002. International students may also contact George Brown College recruitment representatives by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry on the International Contact Us page.
